thread.title: Muslim spokesman: As boy departs, Muslims feel ‘under siege’
thread.title_full: Albuquerque Journal | Muslim spokesman: As boy departs, Muslims feel ‘under siege’

author: Jamie Stengle and David Warren / Associated Press
title: Muslim spokesman: As boy departs, Muslims feel ‘under siege’
text:
Ahmed Mohamed, second from right, listens as Rep. Mike Honda, D-Calif., left, speaks during a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington, Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015. Mohamed is the 14-year-old “clock kid”, freshman, who was arrested in Irving, Texas, for bringing an alarm clock science project to his high school teacher. To the far right is Ahmed’s uncle Aldean Mohamed. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster)
IRVING, Texas — A spokesman for a national Muslim-American group says the decision by the family of a Texas teenager to move to Qatar is not surprising in light of lingering anti-Muslim sentiment that makes many followers of Islam in the U.S. feel as if they are “under siege.”
The teen, Ahmed Mohamed, shot to national prominence last month after he was arrested for bringing a homemade digital clock to school that a teacher mistook for a possible bomb.
On Tuesday, the family announced that they would soon leave the Dallas suburb of Irving and move to Qatar, a wealthy oil nation on the Persian Gulf.
Ibrahim Hooper is spokesman for the Council on American-Islamic Relations. He says the U.S. has seen a significant rise in the level of anti-Muslim sentiment.
